author: Odeinoichus
title: Parrot's Deserve a Home
review:
Set #41024 Parrot's Perch: The next Animal Series 3 set which I've picked up is this one and I like it, it's got a lot of charm and looks somewhat better than Fawn's Forest as far as the build goes. Still these are mostly impulse buys and unless you're really into the Friends line you can easily skip them.

Let's discuss now the pros and cons of this foil packed set.

Pros

  • Green parrot instead of yellow, this is the same bird we've seen in a few LEGO Friends sets only the colouring is new, which is a great improvement. I like the yellow one just fine, but this green one really stands out in my eyes.
  • There are two builds in this pack, one of them is the birdhouse and the other is a small feeding station. Both are fairly simple builds and really quite fun looking, although I feel that the birdhouse is a bit tall when placed next to Mini-Dolls and Mini-Figures.
  • Some nice pieces in this set, not a lot of rare colours to be found but all very useful.

Cons

  • The bows as always look goofy when worn by the animals, it's really the only problem I see with this set and it's a very minor one. I should also point out that one part of the instruction manual is a bit off, because the piece shown and the actual piece that comes in the set are not exactly the same thing. In the manual, instead of the 1x4 fence piece with 4 bars it shows a 1x4 fence piece with 2 bars only. Perhaps at one point this piece was to be used instead and the instructions just weren't changed? Who can say.

Overall I think Series 3 of the Animals have a good value for what you get, this one in particular stands out to me as the best build though I still prefer Fawn's Forest as the best animal piece. Recommended for fans of the Friends line who enjoy the animals a lot.
